[[Fengel]] | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Folcred''' and '''Fastred''' were the eldest children, and the [[twins|twin]] sons of King [[Folcwine]] of [[Rohan]]. == History == In the days of [[Ruling Stewards|Steward]] [[Túrin II]] of [[Gondor]] the [[Haradrim]] had occupied [[South Gondor]] and there were many armed conflicts along the river [[Poros]].{{App|Stewards}}, entry for Steward Túrin II, p. 1054 In {{TA|2885}} emissaries of [[Sauron]] stirred up the Haradrim who crossed the Poros invaded Ithilien with a large army. When King [[Folcwine]] of [[Rohan]] heard of the invasion he fulfilled the [[Oath of Eorl]] and sent many men led by his sons Folcred and Fastred to help Túrin II. Túrin II defeated the Haradrim invaders with the help of the troops from Rohan in a [[Battle of the Crossings of Poros|battle]] at the [[Crossings of Poros]], but Folcred and Fastred fell side by side in battle in Ithilien. They were buried together high upon the shore of the river Poros according to the customs of their [[Rohirrim|people]] in a burial mound, which was called ''[[Haudh in Gwanûr]]''. The mound stood there for a long time and the enemies of Gondor were afraid to pass the mound. == Etymology == '''''Folcred''''' means "people-counsel" (folc-rēd) in [[Old English]]{{HM|IE}}, Giving of Names, p. 216 and contains the components "folc" ("people"{{webcite|website=[http://www.bosworthtoller.com/ Bosworth-Toller Anglo-Saxon Dictionary]|articleurl=https://bosworthtoller.com/45332|articlename=folc|accessed=16 August 2025}}) and "réd" or "rǽd" ("counsel"{{webcite|website=[http://www.bosworthtoller.com/ Bosworth-Toller Anglo-Saxon Dictionary]|articleurl=https://bosworthtoller.com/25462|articlename=rǽd|accessed=16 August 2025}})Didier Salamon & David Giraudeau, Le Livre de la Marche, 2006, entry '''Folcred''', p. 141. '''''Fastred''''' means "firm-counsel" in Old English and contains the components "fast" ("firm"{{webcite|website=[http://www.bosworthtoller.com/ Bosworth-Toller Anglo-Saxon Dictionary]|articleurl=https://bosworthtoller.com/10132|articlename=fast|accessed=16 August 2025}}) and "réd" or "rǽd" ("counsel")Didier Salamon & David Giraudeau, Le Livre de la Marche, 2006, entry '''Fastred''', p. 140.{{HM|RC}}, p. 571 == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | | | | | | | FOL | | | | | | | | | | |FOL=[[Folca]]
